snippet: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency granted a waiver today for California's low-emission vehicle program, allowing the state to phase in and enforce tougher emission standards for cars and trucks beginning with 1994 models.    "California ...
lead_paragraph: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency granted a waiver today for California's low-emission vehicle program, allowing the state to phase in and enforce tougher emission standards for cars and trucks beginning with 1994 models. "California has the worst ozone and carbon-monoxide problems in the nation," said William K. Reilly, the E.P.A. Administrator. "This waiver lets California continue to carry out strong emission-control programs necessary to protect the health of its citizens."
